case_title: MUHAMMAD AFZAL SHAH vs ASMAT KAMAL KHAN, ADVOCATE

accussed_details.name: Asmat Kamal Khan
allegation: Failure to file petition despite undertaking
Advised complainant not to challenge the order
Mental torture and financial expense incurred by complainant

allegations.complainant_claims: Respondent-Advocate failed to file a petition challenging the order of Punjab Labour Court No. VII, Lahore, refusing allowances of Rs.18,125.
allegations.additional_claims: Complainant incurred expenses and mental torture due to frequent visits to Lahore.

respondent_defense.admission: Accepted Rs.500 as initial expense but advised complainant not to challenge the order as no case was made out.

complaint_summary: The complainant alleged that the respondent-Advocate failed to file a petition challenging the Punjab Labour Court No. VII, Lahore's order denying allowances of Rs. 18,125, despite an undertaking. The complainant incurred expenses and mental distress due to frequent visits to Lahore.
investigation_summary: The respondent-Advocate denied the allegations but admitted receiving Rs. 500 as initial expense and advised against challenging the order. He voluntarily compensated the complainant with Rs. 10,000, which was accepted.

settlement.compensation: Respondent voluntarily offered Rs.10,000 to the complainant, which was accepted.

judgment_summary: The Tribunal disposed of the complaint as the matter was mutually settled, with no corroborating evidence supporting either party and no other complaints against the respondent-Advocate.
punishment: No punishment imposed; matter settled mutually.
Decision_or_verdict: Complaint disposed of; no order passed.
remarks: No corroborating evidence in support of either party. No other complaints against the respondent-Advocate. Complaint disposed of.
legal_arguments: Respondent admitted receiving Rs. 500 but argued no case was made out to challenge the order.
Voluntary compensation of Rs. 10,000 resolved the matter.
statutes: Punjab Labour Court No. VII, Lahore

legal_terms.Professional misconduct: Violation of professional duties by an advocate.
legal_terms.Mutual settlement: Resolution of dispute agreed upon by both parties.

words_and_phrases.Mental torture: Emotional distress caused by actions or negligence.
words_and_phrases.Initial expense: Advance payment made for legal services.

summary_vector_notes: Complaint against advocate for failure to file petition and causing financial and emotional distress. Matter resolved through mutual settlement with compensation of Rs. 10,000. No corroborating evidence or further complaints led to disposal of the case.
